title: Node using incorrect chain id, 0 != 1
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description **geth --http --datadir=/path** is synced now on mainnet But when starting **./prysm.sh beacon-chain --http-web3provider=http://localhost:8545/ --mainnet --datadir=/anotherpath** i got **Could not connect to powchain endpoint error=eth1 node using incorrect chain id, 0 != 1** ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Working ok with local geth node (same version) on G√∂erli / Pyrmont Working ok with beacon-node mainnet if using Infura eth1 mainnet endpoint ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction **geth --http --datadir=/path** -> wait to sync **./prysm.sh beacon-chain --http-web3provider=http://localhost:8545/ --mainnet --datadir=/anotherpath** -> fails to connect ## üî• Error 

Starting Prysm beacon-chain --http-web3provider=http://127.0.0.1:8545 --mainnet --datadir=./data-beaconchain --accept-terms-of-use --verbosity=trace

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
  Ubunut 20.10 x64
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
  Prysm 1.0.0beta3
  Geth  1.9.24-stable

As suggested on Discord i ran 

`curl -X POST 127.0.0.1:8545 -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_syncing","id":1}'`

which gives

`{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":{"currentBlock":"0xac3f48","highestBlock":"0xac3fc1","knownStates":"0x202fa76f","pulledStates":"0x202f105d","startingBlock":"0xac35ab"}}`

so id returned by geth seems valid...

That id is not networkid, it's the id you passed on your request {"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_syncing",**"id":1**}.

Also your node seems to be still syncing, when it's synced you should see something like:

```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 1,
    "result": false
}
```

To see network id run:

`curl -X POST 127.0.0.1:8545 -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "net_version", "params": [], "id": 1 }'`

And look at the result field:

`{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 1,
    "result": "3"
}`

3 -> Ropsten

oops, here is the result, still valid but not recognized by prysm..
`{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"1"}`

As discussed on Discord, the weird thing is the request here: [#L398](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/c3451a6ce97bd193da1cbfe92b92c1140d87745e/beacon-chain/powchain/service.go#L398 )

returns **0** as **cID** and **nil** as **err** so it does not trigger an error [#L399](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/c3451a6ce97bd193da1cbfe92b92c1140d87745e/beacon-chain/powchain/service.go#L399 )

I think i was synced when trying to connect, now i deleted everything and i am syncing again (2y3w to go)
while syncing i still get **result: 1** for the proposed request but error in prysm beacon-node...

Ok now Geth is synced again, and the error is gone.
I guess i was not synced properly in the first place. 
Might be good to update the log with "waiting for ETH1 chain to sync" instead of "Node using incorrect chain id, 0 != 1"..

I still have the same problem. I deleted the geth db and synced. But i still get the 0 != 1 error
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"1"}
Keep a lookout for #7895, @Maigre @jonjander . Should make more sense in the event your node is not synced.
